actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend sections 656, 657, and 2113 of title 18, United States Code.

summary.text: Provides that whoever receives, possesses, conceals, stores, barters, sells, or disposes of, any moneys, funds, credits, assets, or securities knowing the same to have been embezzled, abstracted, purloined, or willfully misapplied, shall be subject to the same punishment as the person who embezzled, abstracted, purloined, or willfully misapplied such moneys, funds, credits, assets, or securities. (Amends 18 U.S.C. 656, 657, and 2113)

titles.title: A bill to amend sections 656, 657, and 2113 of title 18, United States Code.
